role.death.name: Thanos
role.death.abilities:
* Target a player on the night they die to collect a stone
* Once you've collected six stones, endgame starts, everyone is notified, and on the next night, you snap away everyone, and win.
role.death.attributes:
* Passively gain a stone each night
* You have to guess who is going to die each night in order to collect stones faster
role.vampire.name: Vampire
role.amnesiac.name: Amnesiac
role.amnesiac.abilities: * Choose a role and become that role at night

wiki.entry.article.404.title: Page not found
wiki.entry.article.404.text: If you see this, please report this as a bug, along with what steps you took to arrive to this page.
wiki.entry.article.help.title: Help
wiki.entry.article.help.text: Learn how to use the wiki.
wiki.entry.article.roles_and_teams.title: Roles and Teams
wiki.entry.article.roles_and_teams.text:
Every player has a role, including you. Your role is told to you in the first chat message you received and at the top of the screen. Almost every role has an ability that can be used during the night, these abilities help you to win.

Every role has a ‚ÄúFaction‚Äù and ‚ÄúAlignment‚Äù which indicate what team you're on and what your goal is. You can see a role's faction and alignment on its wiki page. Town, and Mafia's goal is to be the only remaining team, and to kill every player from every other team. Neutral roles have different goals that vary depending on the role.

Town usually has the majority when the game starts meaning there are more players with town roles. Therefore; town has voting power, and evil players must lie, saying that they are townies even though they are not.

If you are asked to claim a role (to tell others what your role is), It is often best to say that you are a specific town role, such as doctor, or sheriff. In order to make your fake claim believable you must keep a will. 

There can be multiple players with almost any role, so you might not be the only person with the role you have.
wiki.entry.article.phases_and_timeline.t:
The game is always in a phase. Phases run in this order: Morning, Discussion, Voting, Testimony, Judgement, Evening, Night. When there are three or less players alive, the game runs at double the speed.

### Night
When most roles use their abilities. For example, night is when the mafioso chooses who to kill, and the doctor chooses who to protect. Chat is closed at night so players can not communicate with each other. However, some roles can communicate with others at night, for example, the medium can talk to the dead, and mafia can talk with each other.

### Morning
Players see who died last night, and they are added to the graveyard.

### Discussion
Players discuss information they have to try to find out who evils are, or pretend to find out who evils are.

### Voting
Players vote to put a player on trial, this doesn‚Äôt always mean that player is going to be killed. More than half the living players need to vote in order to put someone onto trial. If the voting phase ends before anyone is voted, it goes directly to night after. There can be a maximum of three trials during each day.

### Testimony
This runs right after voting only if a player was voted onto trial, Every player must stop chatting except the player on trial, and the player defends themselves to hope they don't get killed. Usually the player on trial will claim a role and post their will here.

### Judgement
Everyone votes either innocent, or guilty. If there are more guilty votes than innocent votes, the player on trial is killed. Players can also choose to abstain. This is how town usually gets evils killed.

### Evening
A brief period after judgement but before night.
wiki.entry.article.controls.title: Controls
wiki.entry.article.controls.text: You can whisper and target people.
wiki.entry.article.wills_and_notes.title: Wills and Notes
wiki.entry.article.wills_and_notes.text:
## Wills

With any role, it is important to keep a final will. This is a document that shows all the information you claim to have and how you got it. Usually, all players are going to claim that they are a town role, so almost every will you see is a will of a town role.

Each night, the sheriff will choose a player and find out if they are innocent or suspicious. (See the wiki page for ‚Äúsheriff‚Äù to learn more).
Here is a typical sheriff will:

> N1: John-Innocent
N2: Peter-Innocent
N3: Jennifer-Suspicious

This will shows that on night 1, this sheriff found that John was innocent. On night 2, they found Peter innocent. On night 3, they found that Jennifer was suspicious.

The sheriff can post this will in order to claim, and show that Jennifer is likely evil. As an evil player, keeping a fake will is extremely important because a claim is only believable with a will alongside it.

## Notes

Notes are just for you, nobody else can see them. To keep organized, It is often very helpful to write down what role everyone else claimed. For example, a note page might look like this:

> John - Claims doctor
Peter - Claims sheriff
Jennifer - Never claimed, probably evil
wiki.entry.article.visit.title: Visits
wiki.entry.article.visit.text: Visits are how all roles work.
wiki.entry.article.all_language.title: All Language
wiki.entry.role:
# \0 ### \1
### Abilities \2 ### Attributes \3
### Maximum count: \4 ### Sheriff result: \5 ### Defense: \6
wiki.entry.role.jailor.title: Jailor
wiki.entry.role.jailor.abilities:
* Choose one player to jail during the day
* You can execute your prisoners up to three times
wiki.entry.role.jailor.attributes:
* You may anonymously talk with your prisoner at night
* If you execute a town member, you forfeit the ability to jail prisoners
* Jailed players are immune to all attacks, frames, transports, douses and more
* Jailed players can't use their ability
* Other players will know if their target was jailed
wiki.entry.role.mayor.title: Mayor
wiki.entry.role.mayor.abilities: * Reveal during the day to expose your role to everyone and gain 2 more votes
wiki.entry.role.mayor.attributes:
* Your voting power is increased in both voting phase and judgement phase
* Revealing does not increase the number of votes required to put someone on trial
wiki.entry.role.transporter.title: Transporter
wiki.entry.role.transporter.abilities: * Transport two players with each other.
wiki.entry.role.transporter.attributes:
* Transporting a target swaps all visitors to them; for example, all visitors that visit target A will instead visit target B, and vice versa
* You can transport yourself
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.title: Sheriff
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.abilities: * Interrogate a player to find out if they're innocent or suspicious
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.attributes: * Frames, Douses, Hexes, and Enchants can make your target look suspicious wrongly
wiki.entry.role.lookout.title: Lookout
wiki.entry.role.lookout.abilities: * Watch a player to find everyone who visited them
wiki.entry.role.lookout.attributes:
* You can not see astral visits
* You can never see yourself visit
wiki.entry.role.spy.title: Spy
wiki.entry.role.spy.abilities:
* Bug a player to find out what happened to them
* You will get to know who the mafia visited
wiki.entry.role.spy.attributes:
* Your bug will catch when your target sees a message saying they are silenced, roleblocked, protected or transported
* The mafia visits can not be fooled, they are always accurate.
wiki.entry.role.tracker.title: Tracker
wiki.entry.role.tracker.abilities: * Watch a player to find who they visited
wiki.entry.role.tracker.attributes: * You can not see astral visits
wiki.entry.role.seer.title: Seer
wiki.entry.role.seer.abilities: * Examine two players to find if they are friends or enemies
wiki.entry.role.seer.attributes:
* Two players are friends if they could possibly both win together
* A jester can win alongside anyone, therefore the jester has no enemies
* Frames, Douses, Hexes, and Enchants can make your target look like they are a different role
wiki.entry.role.doctor.title: Doctor
wiki.entry.role.doctor.abilities:
* Heal a player to save them from death
* You can heal yourself once
wiki.entry.role.doctor.attributes:
* You give your target powerful defense
* You and your target will know if they were attacked and saved
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.title: Bodyguard
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.abilities:
* Protect a to kill their attacker, but getting attacked yourself
* You can protect yourself once
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.attributes:
* When you guard yourself, you gain powerful defense
* You and your target will know if they were attacked and protected
* You will redirect attacks from your target onto yourself, and you will attack those players back
* Your attack is basic and astral
wiki.entry.role.crusader.title: Crusader
wiki.entry.role.crusader.abilities: * Protect a player to save them from death, but killing one other visitor to them
wiki.entry.role.crusader.attributes:
* You give your target powerful defense
* You will attack A random other player who visited your target
* If both town members and non town members visit your target then you will kill a non townie
* Your attack is basic and astral
wiki.entry.role.escort.title: Escort
wiki.entry.role.escort.abilities: * Target a player to roleblock them
wiki.entry.role.escort.attributes: * Roleblocking a player prevents them from using parts of their ability
wiki.entry.role.medium.title: Medium
wiki.entry.role.medium.abilities:
* You can talk with the dead during the night
* After you died, you can seance a living player twice
wiki.entry.role.medium.attributes:
* You can talk to other mediums during the night as well
* A seance lets you communicate with the living after you died
* Seance has two uses
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.title: Retributionist
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.abilities: * Force a dead player to use their ability on a living one
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.attribute:
* Your ability only works only on townies
* You cant use the same person two times
wiki.entry.role.vigilante.title: Vigilante
wiki.entry.role.vigilante.attributes:
* You have three bullets
* You can't shoot night 1
* If you shoot a town member, you will commit suicide the next night
* Your suicide deals an unstoppable attack towards yourself
* You have a basic attack
wiki.entry.role.veteran.title: Veteran
wiki.entry.role.veteran.abilities: * Target yourself to alert, killing everyone who visits you
wiki.entry.role.veteran.attributes:
* You will know if you attack someone
* You have basic defense while on alert
* You have a powerful attack
* You have three alerts
wiki.entry.role.deputy.title: Deputy
wiki.entry.role.deputy.abilities: * Shoot one player during the day
wiki.entry.role.deputy.attributes:
* When you kill a player, it will be announced that they were shot by a deputy
* If the player you attack survives the attack, they will know they were attacked, but it will not be announced that they were shot by a deputy
* You have a powerful attack
* You have one bullet
wiki.entry.role.mafioso.title: Mafioso
wiki.entry.role.mafioso.abilities: * Target a player to kill them
wiki.entry.role.mafioso.attributes:
* A Godfather can force you to target someone else
* You have a basic attack
* If the mafia has no Mafioso, a member of the mafia will become the Mafioso at the start of night
wiki.entry.role.consort.title: Consort
wiki.entry.role.consort.abilities: * Target a player to roleblock them
wiki.entry.role.consort.attributes: * Roleblocking a player prevents them from using parts of their ability
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.title: Blackmailer
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.abilities: * Blackmail a player to silence them for the next day
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.attributes: * Silenced players can not talk or vote
wiki.entry.role.consigliere.title: Consigliere
wiki.entry.role.consigliere.abilities: * Investigate a player to find out their role, find who they visited, and who visited them
wiki.entry.role.consigliere.attributes:
* Your information can be fooled by other roles like framers, arsonists, and hex masters
* You can read whispers that were not sent to you
* You can never see yourself visit
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.title: Necromancer
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.abilities: * Force a dead player to use their ability on a living player
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.attributes:
* You cant use the same person two times
* You can use the dead player to target two living players, this is useful for roles like framer, transporter, and seer
* Your first target is the player your controlling, the second and third are the players they're targeting
wiki.entry.role.witch.title: Witch
wiki.entry.role.witch.abilities: * Force a player to use their ability on another player
wiki.entry.role.witch.attributes:
* You can force a player to target up to two living players, this is useful for roles like framer, transporter, and seer
* Your first target is the player your possessing, the second and third targets are the players they're targeting
wiki.entry.role.janitor.title: Janitor
wiki.entry.role.janitor.abilities: * Clean a player on the night they die
wiki.entry.role.janitor.attributes:
* Cleaning a player erases the role and will from their grave
* You will know the role and will of a player you clean
wiki.entry.role.framer.title: Framer
wiki.entry.role.framer.abilities: * Target two players to frame the first one
wiki.entry.role.framer.attributes:
* The framed player will look like the mafioso to town investigative roles
* It will look like first target visited your second target, non attacking
* You can only choose non mafia members for your first target, but anyone as your second target
* Your second visit is astral
wiki.entry.role.jester.title: Jester
wiki.entry.role.jester.abilities:
* Get lynched to win
* After you are lynched, you can haunt a player who didn't vote innocent
wiki.entry.role.jester.attributes:
* If you haunt nobody, you will haunt a random player
* You get basic defense on night one
* Haunting is an unstoppable astral attack
wiki.entry.role.executioner.title: Executioner
wiki.entry.role.executioner.abilities:
* Get your target lynched to win
* If your target dies by something other than lynching, you will be converted to a jester
wiki.entry.role.executioner.attributes:
* After you win you will commit suicide
* Your target will always be a townie, but never town power, or town killing
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.title: Doomsayer
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.abilities: * Guess the role of three living players in one night, killing them and winning the game
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.attributes:
* When you win, you will commit suicide using an unstoppable attack
* You have to guess the exact role of townies, but just the faction of all other roles
* You can not try to guess town investigative roles
* If there is not enough players left for you to guess and win the game, you will convert to a jester
* You do not visit, so the transporter doesn't effect your attack
* Your attack is unstoppable
wiki.entry.role.vampire.title: Vampire
wiki.entry.role.vampire.abilities: * Bite a player to convert them to a vampire
wiki.entry.role.vampire.attributes:
* Only the newest vampire can choose to bite
* Vampires can not bite on the night immediately following a night that they successfully converted another vampire
* You can not convert a player with defense
* If there are four or more vampires, they can not choose to bite someone
